reviews.review_msg: Unlike other profs, he does not scale grades. He strictly follows the grading scheme (below 50% is F, 50-59 is D, etc). For example, he will not hesitate to give F to the whole class even if the class average is well below 50%. I should have taken 406 when Craig Scratchley was responsible.

Smart and able to communicate clearly. Not too much work was required. The ethics portion was interesting. Exams focused a little too much on the law aspect, which was just reciting from memory. Tutorials were the most enjoyable hour of my week.

I don`t understand why this guy wants to make this useless 2 credit course such hard for students. This course involves a lot of work as those 3+ credit courses do, and you might get a bad grade even you thought you study hard. Mike, stop giving students a hard time by teaching this BS course, it won`t show how brilliant you are.
He absolutly hates students! he mkes you work so hard for a useless 2 credit course. at the end leaves you with a bad grade....
He is picky and his course is subjective.  An easy to pass course but it lowers your GPA unless your GPA is low
